sen.j: 智尊（ちそん、天武天皇元年（672年7月22日）は、日本の飛鳥時代の人物である。
sen.e: Chison (July22, 672) lived during the Asuka period in Japan.
Chison (year of birth unknown-August 23, 672) was a person from the Asuka Period in Japan.
sen.cmt: 英文を書き換えました。天武天皇元年7月22日は西暦672年8月23日です。
sen.e: Chison (year of birth unknown-August 23, 672) was a person from the Asuka Period in Japan.

sen.j: 旧仮名遣いでの読みは同じ。
sen.e: The reading in the old Japanese syllabary characters is the same.
In the old Japanese syllabary characters, his name was pronounced in the same way.
sen.cmt: 英文を書き換えました。
sen.e: In the old Japanese syllabary characters, his name was pronounced in the same way.
There is no Kabane (hereditary title).
He had no Kabane (hereditary title).
sen.cmt: 英文を書き換えました。
sen.e: He had no Kabane (hereditary title).

sen.j: 672年の壬申の乱のとき大友皇子（弘文天皇）側の将となり、瀬田の戦いで先鋒となったが、戦死した。
sen.e: He rose to be commander of the OTOMO no Miko (Prince Otomo, the Emperor Kobun) side and was in the vanguard of the forces in the Jinshin War but died in the Battle of Seta.
During the Jinshin War which broke out in 672, he fought for Prince Otomo (Emperor Kobun) as a commander, but died in the Battle of Seta when he led the vanguard.
sen.cmt: 英文を書き換えました。
sen.e: During the Jinshin War which broke out in 672, he fought for Prince Otomo (Emperor Kobun) as a commander, but died in the Battle of Seta when he led the vanguard.

sen.j: 『日本書紀』の瀬田の戦いの箇所に登場するのみで、系譜などは一切不明である。
sen.e: His only mention in the "Chronicles of Japan" is for the Battle of Seta, nothing is known of his background.
His name only found in "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan) concerning in the Battle of Seta, but his genealogy etc. is unknown.
sen.cmt: 英文を書き換えました。
sen.e: His name only found in "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan) concerning in the Battle of Seta, but his genealogy etc. is unknown.

sen.j: 当時の日本人に似つかわしくない名から、渡来人ではないかという推測がある。
sen.e: There has been speculation that he was a Toraijin (settler) due to his name - unusual in Japan at that time.

He is considered to be a Toraijin (people from overseas, especially from China and Korea, who settled in early Japan and introduced Continental culture to the Japanese) as the name is not common for the then Japanese.
sen.cmt: 英文を書き換えました。
sen.e: He is considered to be a Toraijin (people from overseas, especially from China and Korea, who settled in early Japan and introduced Continental culture to the Japanese) as the name is not common for the then Japanese.

sen.j: 壬申の年（672年）の7月22日、壬申の乱の戦況は大友皇子に不利となり、都である近江宮のそばまで村国男依らの敵軍が押し寄せた。
sen.e: On July 22, 672, the war situation of the Jinshin War had deteriorated to OTOMO no Miko, and the enemy such as MIRAKUNI no Oyori advanced as near as Omi no Miya, the capital.
On August 23, 672, Prince Otomo became overwhelmed in the Jinshin War, and MURAKUNI no Oyori, the enemy, advanced his troops close to Omi no miya, the capital.
sen.cmt: 英文を書き換えました。
sen.e: On August 23, 672, Prince Otomo became overwhelmed in the Jinshin War, and MURAKUNI no Oyori, the enemy, advanced his troops close to Omi no miya, the capital.

sen.j: 皇子は群臣を従え自ら出陣し、瀬田の橋の西に陣取って東からくる敵を迎え撃った。
sen.e: The prince was accompanied by a large number of his retainers and took the field by himself and positioned themselves in the west of the bridge of Seta and faced the enemy as they approached from the east.

The prince himself went into the battle field accompanied with a large number of his retainers and stationed his troops in the west side of the bridge of Seta to intercept the enemy coming from the east.
sen.cmt: 英文を書き換えました。
sen.e: The prince himself went into the battle field accompanied with a large number of his retainers and stationed his troops in the west side of the bridge of Seta to intercept the enemy coming from the east.

sen.j: 戦闘は川を隔てて矢を飛ばしあう射撃戦となった。
sen.e: The battle became a fire fight across the river.
The battle became a shooting fight with bow and arrows across the river.
sen.cmt: 英文を書き換えました。
sen.e: The battle became a shooting fight with bow and arrows across the river.

sen.j: このとき智尊は先鋒の将となり、精兵を率いて瀬田の橋を守った。
sen.e: Chison became the spearhead commander and led experienced troops to protect the bridge of Seta.
Chison led the experienced troops as the vanguard commander and defended the bridge of Seta.
sen.cmt: 英文を書き換えました。
sen.e: Chison led the experienced troops as the vanguard commander and defended the bridge of Seta.

sen.j: 橋の中を三丈切断して、長い板を一つおき、これに綱を結びつけた。
sen.e: He cut out the middle of the bridge and placed a long board with a rope tied around it.
He cut about nine meters of the middle of the bridge and placed a long board with a rope tied around it.
He cut about nine meters of the middle of the bridge and placed a long board with a rope tied around it.

sen.j: もし板を踏んで敵が渡ろうとしたら、すぐに綱を引いて落とそうというのである。
sen.e: The idea was to pull the rope as soon as the enemy tries to cross the river and step on the board.
The idea was to pull the rope and make the enemy fall down off the bridge as soon as they tried to cross the river and step on the board.
The idea was to pull the rope and make the enemy fall down off the bridge as soon as they tried to cross the river and step on the board.

sen.j: 敵軍はしばらく進めなかったが、やがて大分稚臣が進み出て、鎧を重ね着して突進し、板を渡って綱を切った。
sen.e: The enemy found it difficult to advance for a while, but OKIDA no Wakaomi bravely came forth in layered armours and rushed crossed the board and cut the rope.
The enemy had difficulty in advancing the troops for some time, but OKIDA no Wakaomi bravely broke away with layered armors and rushed across the board and cut the rope.
sen.cmt: 英文を書き換えました。
sen.e: The enemy had difficulty in advancing the troops for some time, but OKIDA no Wakaomi bravely broke away with layered armors and rushed across the board and cut the rope.

sen.j: これを見た軍勢は乱れて逃げ出した。
sen.e: The troops retreated in confusion.
Seeing OKIDA's courageous effort, the troops of Chison started to flee in disorder.
sen.cmt: 英文を書き換えました。
sen.e: Seeing OKIDA's courageous effort, the troops of Chison started to flee in disorder.

sen.j: 智尊は刀を抜いて退く者を斬ったが、止めることができなかった。
sen.e: Chison tried to prevent them from retreating with his sword but could not stop it.
Chison draw his sword and killed his running troops, but he couldn't stop them.
sen.cmt: 英文を書き換えました。
sen.e: Chison draw his sword and killed his running troops, but he couldn't stop them.

sen.j: かくして智尊は橋のそばで斬られた。
sen.e: And Chison was hacked to death by the bridge.
And Chison was slain near the bridge.
sen.cmt: 英文を書き換えました。
sen.e: And Chison was slain near the bridge.

sen.j: 大友皇子は翌日自殺し、壬申の乱は終わった。
sen.e: OTOMO no Miko committed suicide the next day, and it was the end of the Jinshin War.
Prince Otomo committed suicide the next day, and it was the end of the Jinshin War.
Prince Otomo committed suicide the next day, and it was the end of the Jinshin War.
